    data package¶

    Submodules¶

    data.data_fetcher module¶

    class src.data.data_fetcher.DataHandler(fyres_instance, scheduler)¶

    Bases: object

    Handles fetching, loading, updating, and backing up trading data for automated trading.

    Parameters:

    • fyres_instance (fyersModel) –

    • scheduler (BackgroundScheduler) –

    trading_mode¶

    Mode of trading, either ‘BACKTEST’ or ‘LIVE’.

    Type:

    str

    fyres¶

    Instance of the FYRES API client.

    Type:

    FyresInstance

    file_path¶

    Path to the directory where ticker data is stored.

    Type:

    str

    symbols¶

    List of trading symbols.

    Type:

    List[str]

    data¶

    Dictionary storing data for each symbol.

    Type:

    Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]

    data_len¶

    Duration of data to maintain, in seconds.

    Type:

    int

    callback¶

    Callback function to execute after loading data.

    Type:

    Optional[Callable[[Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]], None]]

    scheduler¶

    Scheduler instance for managing jobs.

    Type:

    Scheduler

    backup_data()¶

    Backs up the current trading data by saving each symbol’s data to a CSV file.

    Return type:

    None

    configure_scheduler()¶

    Configures the scheduler by adding necessary jobs, such as data backup.

    Return type:

    None

    fetch_data(symbol, start_epoch_time, end_epoch_time)¶

    Fetches trading data for a given symbol between start and end epoch times.

    Parameters:

    • symbol (str) – The trading symbol to fetch data for.

    • start_epoch_time (float) – The start time in epoch seconds.

    • end_epoch_time (float) – The end time in epoch seconds.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing the fetched trading data with columns defined in TICKER_COLS.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    fetch_full_year_data(symbol)¶

    Fetches a full year’s worth of data for the given symbol.

    Parameters:

    symbol (str) – The trading symbol to fetch data for.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing the fetched data.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    get_scheduler()¶

    Retrieves the scheduler instance.

    Returns:

    The scheduler instance used for managing jobs.

    Return type:

    Scheduler

    load_historical_data()¶

    Loads historical data and invokes the registered callback if available.

    Return type:

    None

    load_or_initialize_data(symbol)¶

    Loads existing data for a symbol from a CSV file or initializes it by fetching full-year data.

    Parameters:

    symbol (str) – The trading symbol to load data for.

    Returns:

    The loaded or initialized data for the symbol.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    register_callback(callback)¶

    Registers a callback function to be called after loading historical data.

    Parameters:

    callback (Callable[[Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]], None]) – A function that takes the data dictionary as input.

    Return type:

    None

    schedule_data_updates()¶

    Schedule regular data updates during trading hours.

    Return type:

    None

    update_data(symbol, df)¶

    Updates the data for a specific symbol by fetching missing data and concatenating it.

    Parameters:

    • symbol (str) – The trading symbol to update data for.

    • df (pd.DataFrame) – Existing DataFrame containing data for the symbol.

    Return type:

    None

    update_data_regularly()¶

    Regularly update the data during trading hours.

    Returns:

    Updated data dictionary if within trading hours, else None.

    Return type:

    Optional[Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]]

    Extracts and formats basic information from the raw data.

    Parameters:

    fetch_order_book_data()¶
